definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc

sentences.english: So basically, the bow doesn't put-out as much energy as you put-in.
sentences.chinese: 所以基本上，船首不會使出更多能源作爲你的。

sentences.english: The martingale guy was snapped at the base near the bowsprit cap.
sentences.chinese: 鞅傢伙是結束在基地附近的船首斜桅帽。
雷達轉換至相對運動船首向上。

sentences.english: The sea water foams under the bow.
sentences.chinese: 海水在船首下面泛起浪花。

sentences.english: A sail, such as a jib, set forward of a foremast.
sentences.chinese: 船首帆如三角帆等安裝前桅前方的帆。

sentences.english: Foremast shall be installed on the centerline of ship's stem.
sentences.chinese: 前桅安裝在船首中心線上。

sentences.english: He stands on the prow looking at the sea.
The sediment-encrusted bow emerges in high-intensity lights trained on it by submersibles.
sentences.chinese: 被沉積物包裹着的船首顯現在潛艇上的強烈燈光下。

sentences.english: Passing ahead of me may result in a close-quarters situation.
sentences.chinese: 從我船首通過可能會導致緊迫局面。

sentences.english: Bowsprit Side view of the bowsprit in work progress, not finished.
sentences.chinese: 製作中的船首斜桅側視圖，尚未完成。

sentences.english: The war trophies were the prows of six ships that they had captured.
sentences.chinese: 而戰利品則是他們所俘獲的六艘戰艦的船首。

sentences.english: Make fast two tugs on each bow.
sentences.chinese: 把每舷船首兩艘拖船綁牢。

sentences.english: A spar projecting from the bow of a vessel .
The lad stretched full length by the mast seems oblivious to the spray of the bow waves.
sentences.chinese: 桅杆旁全身伸展的小夥子好像沒有察覺船首的浪花。

definition: the bow or prow of a ship
sides of a ship/ship's railing/fig. the dividing line between shipboard expenses and onshore freight charges
side of a ship or an aircraft
